verses.plain: Then Job answered and said,

tokens.t: Then Job answered and said,

verses.plain: I have heard many such things: miserable comforters are ye all.

tokens.t: I have heard many such things: miserable comforters
ye all.

verses.plain: Shall vain words have an end? or what emboldeneth thee that thou answerest?

tokens.t: Shall vain words have an end? or what emboldeneth thee that thou answerest?

verses.plain: I also could speak as ye do: if your soul were in my soul’s stead, I could heap up words against you, and shake mine head at you.

tokens.t: I also could speak as ye
if your soul were in my soul’s stead, I could heap up words against you, and shake mine head at you.

verses.plain: But I would strengthen you with my mouth, and the moving of my lips should asswage your grief.

tokens.t: I would strengthen you with my mouth, and the moving of my lips should asswage

verses.plain: Though I speak, my grief is not asswaged: and though I forbear, what am I eased?

tokens.t: Though I speak, my grief is not asswaged: and
I forbear, what am I eased?

verses.plain: But now he hath made me weary: thou hast made desolate all my company.

tokens.t: But now he hath made me weary: thou hast made desolate all my company.

verses.plain: And thou hast filled me with wrinkles, which is a witness against me: and my leanness rising up in me beareth witness to my face.

tokens.t: And thou hast filled me with wrinkles,
is a witness
and my leanness rising up in me beareth witness to my face.

verses.plain: He teareth me in his wrath, who hateth me: he gnasheth upon me with his teeth; mine enemy sharpeneth his eyes upon me.

tokens.t: He teareth
in his wrath, who hateth me: he gnasheth upon me with his teeth; mine enemy sharpeneth his eyes upon me.

verses.plain: They have gaped upon me with their mouth; they have smitten me upon the cheek reproachfully; they have gathered themselves together against me.

tokens.t: They have gaped upon me with their mouth; they have smitten me upon the cheek reproachfully; they have gathered themselves together against me.

verses.plain: God hath delivered me to the ungodly, and turned me over into the hands of the wicked.

tokens.t: God hath delivered me to the ungodly, and turned me over into the hands of the wicked.

verses.plain: I was at ease, but he hath broken me asunder: he hath also taken me by my neck, and shaken me to pieces, and set me up for his mark.

tokens.t: I was at ease, but he hath broken me asunder: he hath also taken
by my neck, and shaken me to pieces, and set me up for his mark.

verses.plain: His archers compass me round about, he cleaveth my reins asunder, and doth not spare; he poureth out my gall upon the ground.

tokens.t: His archers compass me round about, he cleaveth my reins asunder, and doth not spare; he poureth out my gall upon the ground.

verses.plain: He breaketh me with breach upon breach, he runneth upon me like a giant.

tokens.t: He breaketh me with breach upon breach, he runneth upon me like a giant.

verses.plain: I have sewed sackcloth upon my skin, and defiled my horn in the dust.

tokens.t: I have sewed sackcloth upon my skin, and defiled my horn in the dust.

verses.plain: My face is foul with weeping, and on my eyelids is the shadow of death;

tokens.t: My face is foul with weeping, and on my eyelids
the shadow of death;

verses.plain: Not for any injustice in mine hands: also my prayer is pure.

tokens.t: Not for
injustice in mine hands: also my prayer
pure.

verses.plain: O earth, cover not thou my blood, and let my cry have no place.

tokens.t: O earth, cover not thou my blood, and let my cry have no place.

verses.plain: Also now, behold, my witness is in heaven, and my record is on high.

tokens.t: Also now, behold, my witness
in heaven, and my record
on high.

verses.plain: My friends scorn me: but mine eye poureth out tears unto God.

tokens.t: My friends scorn me:
mine eye poureth out
unto God.

verses.plain: O that one might plead for a man with God, as a man pleadeth for his neighbour!

tokens.t: O that one might plead for a man with God, as a man
for his neighbour!

verses.plain: When a few years are come, then I shall go the way whence I shall not return.

tokens.t: When a few years are come, then I shall go the way
I shall not return.

footnotes.text: what…: Heb. what goeth from me?
hath…: Heb. hath shut me up
on high: Heb. in the high places
scorn me: Heb. are my scorners
a few…: Heb. years of number
